speaker: Help Desk
message: If you have noticed the examples given, only the 1st letter of the 1st word needs to be in caps

speaker: Help Desk
message: For the in-text, you only need to cite the author's last name

speaker: Help Desk
message: Ok, in this case, you will have to capitalise the article title as presented to you

message: It Was a Bad Week for Billionaires With Delusions of Saving the World

speaker: Help Desk
message: This is because for both New York Times and Straits Times, they have a print edition so they are considered newspapers

speaker: Help Desk
message: Hence for both titles, you need to italicise them in the reference list
